availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Peart (Rochester, NY, wagoner 2nd Ky Inf. and pvt. 39th Ky Inf. (U.S.A.).)

body.p: Rochester, New York, soldier. New York native. Son of Richard Peart and Ann Peart. Student in Rochester in 1850. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as teamster and wagoner from June 8, 1861. Reported as deserted from Louisville, Kentucky, on October 1, 1862. Assigned to the 39th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) by order of General Palmer on May 3, 1865. Reported as deserted from Paintsville, Kentucky, on July 27, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New York, Monroe County, Rochester, Ward 3, 126A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 588-89.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 404-05.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0167, 0428, 0495.
